faultset.name: CDDLM_FAULTS
faultset.description: These are the faults that are explicitly part of the CDDLM deployment api. They are returned by the endpoint when the message sent is (somehow) not compatible with the current implementation or state of the server.

fault.name: BAD_ARGUMENT
fault.errormessage: A bad argument was sent in a message
fault.documentation: This is the generic response when some argument is out of bounds, invalid or otherwise not parseable. The wire message should be extended to explain which particular part of the message is at fault, where possible.

fault.name: NOT_UNDERSTOOD
fault.wiremessage: A mustUnderstand option was not understood
fault.errormessage: A mustUnderstand option was not understood
fault.documentation: An option was sent to this deployment endpoint with a mustUnderstand header that was true, yet it was not understood. The particular header should be identified in the subcode.

fault.name: NESTED_EXCEPTION
fault.errormessage: This message contains a nested exception
fault.documentation: A nested exception is being thrown.

fault.name: NO_SUCH_APPLICATION
fault.wiremessage: The specified application was not found
fault.errormessage: There is no such application running in the deployment system
fault.documentation: The name or URI used to refer to an application did not map to an existing application. Either it has already terminated, or it was never deployed.

fault.name: WRONG_APPLICATION_STATE
fault.wiremessage: The application is in the wrong state for the operation.
fault.errormessage: The application is in the wrong state for the operation.
fault.documentation: An attempt was made to move an application to a new state, but it cannot make that state transition from the state it is currently in. For example, you cannot terminate an already-terminated application.

fault.name: UNSUPPORTED_LANGUAGE
fault.errormessage: The deployment server does not support that language
fault.documentation: The language (or language version) is not supported. The list of supported languages can be enumerated from the server information operation

fault.name: UNSUPPORTED_CALLBACK
fault.wiremessage: The callback option is not supported
fault.errormessage: The deployment server does not support that callback mechanism
fault.documentation: The callback option request is not supported by this server.
